title: Shall I play ranked?
body:
Hello everyone, 

I'm wondering if I should play ranked. I only have 227 wins, 24 champions, and 2 rune pages. Nonetheless, I have maybe 4-5 champions I can pick with my eyes closed and confidently play with, maybe 10 champions I'm pretty good with. Been playing in the jungle since I hit level 30 (not lately though). Is it worth it for me to pursue ranked, or should I get more wins, etc, before I try it?

Here's my stats: http://na.op.gg/summoner/userName=Lunathil

replies.body: You know you're ready for ranked when you dont mind hearing "WOW NOOB GO KILL YOURSELF AND DO THE WORLD A FAVOR!" every single time that you make a mistake.

You seem to have a wrong idea what ranked is about, methinks.  Based upon what you are saying, you look to be taking the wrong approach to it
Ranked Queue is a separate queue for semi-serious competitive play.  It comes with leagues so that you can have milestones that can give you a very rough estimate of your improvement in play.

That's about it.

That's all ranked is.  If you want a queue with a record of matches because you want to improve your own play at League of Legends, then ranked is for you.  Give it a shot!
Or don't!  The majority of players don't bother with it either.  Do whatever you want.

P.S.  Those stats are nigh meaningless; Don't let anyone fool you otherwise.
1100 MMR is like Bronze II or something. That is your normal game MMR.
Keeping in mind your normal MMR is probably going to be a few hundred above your ranked MMR. You're better off waiting.
How do you even raise normal MMR?

> [{quoted}](name=Lunathil,realm=NA,application-id=WEuoGbmp,discussion-id=Fdv4e3I4,comment-id=0000000000000000,timestamp=2015-04-12T23:54:50.099+0000)
>
> How do you even raise normal MMR?

win more normals than lose. better ratio+ more games = higher ratio

i think it factors both in to your score, kinda like your ratio is X, and Y total games played, so your MMR is x(Y/avg for current ratio) 

this obviously isn't the formula to get your mmr, but It just shows both your total games played and your W/L ratio being factored into your over all score.
